Reviews.Content: Great location, everything else is poor. The only saving grace for this hotel is the location. Close to everything in Florence you'd want to see. The rooms, furniture and staff we less than expected. First, the single room is that-only for one single person, not a couple. We had to upgrade at the insistance of the staff for 40 euro more than we had booked. The double bed was 2 metal cots pushed together with one thin, hard mattress and 2 equally slim pillows. The bathroom has an incredibly high tub/shower with a plastic step stool to get into. An older person would have difficulty getting in or out. The furniture in the room was very old-its a stetch to call this modern as the description states. The free breakfast consisted of a basket of bread and juice served but a stern lady who did not speak one word. The front desk staff was pleasant but not very helpful. There is internet wi-fi but they charge extra for that. Finally they allow you to store your bags after check-out but be careful. We were told to leave the bags near the front door on the floor, which we reluctantly did. When we returned a new front desk agent was there who we had never seen and he had never seen us. We went in took our bags and left without a word from the agent. Anyone could have taken our bags and no one would have questioned them or seemed to care. Again, the location probably cannot be beat, but thats the only positive words I can offer.
Reviews.Author: OrlTerry

Reviews.Content: An excellentsmall hotel The Signoria, two minutes walk from the Ponte Vecchio, is an excellent small hotel with clean rooms and adequate bathrooms; the staff is friendly and competent and we could not hope for better accomodation within the prize range. Highly recommended.
Reviews.Author: ExpatSydney

Reviews.Content: Okay hotel, terrible area if you want to sleep I stayed at the Hotel Della Signoria for two weeks this May. While the hotel itself was okay (although there were some issues, more on those later) the area was horrible at night. Night after night there was screaming and yelling of people carrying on in the streets below. Some nights, such as Fridays and Saturdays became so loud that even with ear plugs in and a sleeping pill, I was unable to fall asleep. This noise would sometimes go as late as 4 am. I am not some little 'country bumpkin' who can't deal with a little street noise; I live in a city of 1,000,000 people and I lived right downtown for several years. I am used to, and actually like street noise (traffic, sirens, people coming and going); however, listening to rowdy, screaming drunks every night is unacceptable.Now on to the hotel itself. The front desk staff were pleasant and friendly for the most part. One of the gentlemen up there was particularly helpful and helped us to plan a lovely guided tour in Tuscany. The cleaning ladies and breakfast ladies were also fairly pleasant.The rooms were inconsistent. Our first room was on the fourth floor and was not very nice - it looked like it was decorated in the early 1970s and the bathroom and fixtures all looked like they were from that era as well. In this room, we didn't have a shower (just a hand-held sprayer in a tub) and the taps wouldn't turn off and dripped constantly. Due to the above mentioned noise, we asked to be moved to a different room that faced a side-street rather than the main street (which actually made no difference to the noise levels). We were moved to a room on the fifth floor which was actually a lot nicer. The decor was more modern and the bathroom had taps that worked and a real shower; however, in this room the toilet didn't work. We had to plan our flushes because the toilet would only flush once an hour, and if anyone in a neighbouring room flushed, then you better start timing again. This was pretty gross and frustrating.The breakfast was okay but nothing special. I have been to many different hotels all over Italy and it is usually standard for there to be a small buffet with meats, cheeses, breads, cereal, yogurt and fruit - this hotel only offered you bread unless you wanted to pay extra, so if you can opt out of the breakfast, do.The hotel was very close to all the main sites in Florence, but in the future I would stay across the river in the Oltrano area or perhaps out of town all together. The noise made it very hard to be enthusiastic about staying in this area of Florence.
Reviews.Author: PinkUnicorn

Reviews.Content: Highly recommended We absolutely loved this hotel; situated right in the heart of Florence nr the Pont Vecchio bridge [stunning], Palazzo della Signoria, cafes, bars, shops. Just beautiful.The hotel is perfectly situated and is just lovely; for the price we paid I would not hesitate but to return [and will do so] and would recommend this hotel highly.
Reviews.Author: Suepoppet

Reviews.Content: The ultimate location This hotel is not luxory, but you will struggle to find a better situated hotel than this. However having said that it is not luxory, it is a more than adaquate small scale hotel standard and clean. The hotel is less than a minute from the Ponte Vecchio, uffizi museum , and a welth of excellent restaurants.Only bad point was the limited brekky...
Reviews.Author: ThomoBerks_UK

Reviews.Content: OK We stayed at this hotel for one night in October 2007. It is in a good location in the historic centre of the city near to the Ponte Vecchio and is walking distance from the main station. However this means it is a bit noisy at night and first thing in the morning.The room was a little on the small side though and looked as if it needed a good clean and a bit of smartening up. Fine for one night if you are out and about seeing the city.
Reviews.Author: chall32

Reviews.Content: Excellent Location We stayed at this hotel for one night while in Florence and I would definetly return. The location was excellent. Walking distance to all major attractions. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. Rooms were very clean. No complaints what so ever about this place. I will definetly return!
Reviews.Author: worldtravCanada

Reviews.Content: Great location We stayed in this hotel for three days while on a short holiday in Florence. The best thing about the hotel was the location, which is right in the heart of Florence and easy walking distance to most of the attractions. The hotel itself is rather basic and doesn't have any views or extras. It probably isn't a good choice if you like the be pampered. However, our room was clean and it felt like an authentic Italian experience rather than a chain hotel. Breakfast is served on an attractive roof terrace and the staff were friendly and helpful and spoke good English.
Reviews.Author: cwalton

Reviews.Content: Unbelievable Location Stayed for 3 nights starting July 1.Location is on a side street a couple of blocks from the Ponte Vecchio and Uffizi Gallery. The side street keeps out the noise but you're an easy walk from a lot of what Florence has to offer. It's a 10 Euro ride from the train station. Very pleasant front desk staff and quick to help when needed. Breakfast served on the second floor patio -- no view but the weather nice and surroundings charming.
Reviews.Author: texascouple21

Reviews.Content: A hovel of a room ! Well going by the other reviews on here none of you guys were unfortunate enough to be allocated the room I stayed in for 5 nights. It was the most dank and miserable one that I have ever had the misfortune to stay in. Situated on the second floor it looked onto a small courtyard but there was never enough sunlight to reach into my room and help lift the gloom.Room was clean at first but it was not cleaned every day during my stay, furniture was old and chipped including a glass topped desk with a rough crack in the top. Oh and yes the walls are thin, very thin and you can hear ahem far too much from the guests next door.Old guy on reception was very dour and never made me feel welcome. As for the breakfast, yes it is indeed on a pleasant little balcony with potted pink and red geraniums but ! The service was so slow and the food was not worth the wait, a paltry bowl of bread buns and a mixture of jams and processed cheese. Plus once the tables were vacated the local sparrows fly down and peck the remnants in the wicker bowls. So check your bread buns for any suspicious holes.I love Florence and this hotel is ideally situated between the Ponte Vecchio and Piazza della Signoria, but I would never ever set foot in this hotel again.
Reviews.Author: Durhamguy

Reviews.Content: GREAT LOCATION This was my second stay in this hotel this year - I loved the location, the price is good and the staff is great. I want to mention Restaurant Pennello near the American Express Office - excellent food, including the very best steak I have ever had, anywhere, and the Panna Cotta for dessert - heaven! I plan to return and to stay there again. E.F.
Reviews.Author: efloydatty

Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, Great Location We loved this hotel. The location is perfect. 50 meters from Piazza della Signoria and 100 meters from Ponte Vecchio. We had a very large room and from our balcony we could look down to the bridge. We didn't have any noise. The breakfast is very adequate and served on a lovely outdoor terrace, again you can look down and see the bridge. The staff were lovely and we couldn't believe that this place wasn't fully booked. Excellent value for money. I think some people have unrealistic expectations for the amount they spend.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not a Good Choice! The hotel offers very basic service for its price. The room was equipped with old, scratched wooden furniture and was smelly and noisy. No hair dryer and not even a box of Kleenex in the bathroom! Breakfast was a joke....No self-service, just a bunch of buns and croissants served with coffee by someone with no option of asking for more! I won't recommend this hotel to anyone and will never stay there again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: We loved it! Spacious,clean, quiet room, friendly staff and perfect location-just 1 minute stroll to the Uffizi and 2 minutes walk to the Ponte Vecchio. We are used to budget hotels and this was fantastic value in the centre of everything!! The little lady who does all the breakfasts is lovely and really makes you feel welcome, as did the other staff.
Reviews.Author: Yaffle

Reviews.Content: What a superb location My wife and I recently stayed at this lovely hotel. The location is fantastic. Just a few yards from the Ponte Vecchio, and within a few minutes walk of all the major attractions. our room was lovely, clean, comfortable and quiet.The staff were very helpful and polite. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel, or staying there again myself!
Reviews.Author: wenmore

Reviews.Content: Perfect Location for Florence As well as it's superb location - 2 minutes from Ponte Vecchio, 3 minutes from Piazza della Signoria, this hotel benefits from excellent staff, beautiful breakfast terrace and reception lobby. Bedrooms are disappointing but adequate.
Reviews.Author: Hazel13

Reviews.Content: friendly staff My room was clean and the bathroom fresh and new, and because it was at the back, there was no street noise. The smell comes with the territory of being in an ancient city - many places built a few centuries ago have this problem and I certainly didn't notice it in my room. It was small, but the price and location were right. The breakfast is pretty stingy, but the staff there were most helpful and friendly. If I returned to Florence, I would stay there again.
Reviews.Author: LBrock

Reviews.Content: Central location One word to describe this hotel : quaint. It's a small three-star hotel in a very central location in Florence. You step out of your hotel and you can immediately see the crowds of people walking toward Ponte Vecchio. The hotel, I was told, is a family-run business. The staff were quite friendly and helpful although I had to feel guilty when our suitcases were lugged up three flights of stairs to our rooms by an elderly woman, who also serves the breakfast in the morning and cleans out the rooms. The walls are quite thin, we could hear people running up stairs and what the people were doing next door. You could also hear noises coming from outside from people who don't seem to go home until about 3 in the morning. We had to close the windows or invest in earplugs to get a relatively good night's sleep. I would probably stay at this hotel again if I didn't have time to investigate other hotels but I'm pretty sure you can get better three-star hotels within the vicinity of Ponte Vecchio for the price that we paid, which was AUD$400 a night.
Reviews.Author: aimzster

Reviews.Content: Smelly and loud! The other reviewers are correct, the location is in the heart of all the action in Florence. However, in my opinion, that is also the problem with this hotel. It's like Spring Break Florence all night below your window. Not only can you hear the outside noise coming in through the windows, but the room walls are paper thin. We could actually hear complete conversations from guests in the next room. The other big problem with this hotel is that it must be built over some ancient Florentine sewer or something. It stinks! You notice it right when you walk in the lobby. The sewerage smell comes and goes, but at times is overpowering. If smells and sounds don't bother you, this place would probably be fine. The rooms are not luxurious, but they are comfortable. The continental breakfast is bare-bones (a croissant and coffee, that's it).
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: in the heart of the action I stayed at this hotel in Sept of 2004.Up to standard with any Europeon 3 star hotel the strength of this hotel lies in the fact that it is located in the heart of the main sites of Florence. 4 min from the front doors you are at Pointe Vecchio and 5 min more you are at Pitti Palace! More restaurants and Gelateria than I can list are right at the doorstep.The staff are friendly and breakfast is served on a rooftop terrace! My only problem is that the location is a bit noisy. You should pack earplugs as conversations from the street below can be heard all through the night!I will be happy to stay at Hotel Signoria again!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good for those on a budget Perfect location for shopping, museum hopping, and sightseeing. Rooms were very small, foam like beds, clean, sparse decor, a little depressing for a stay longer than two nights. The price for this location is good, so this balances the negatives.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Right in the heart If you want to be in the heart of the action, this is the place for you. We were moments away by foot from most of Florences many attractions. The hotel is situated about 200 metres from the Ponte Vecchio. The room we stayed in was spacious and clean and well air conditioned. The staff were very professional and courteous and always able to assist us.The only complaint we had was that it was a little bit loud at times and the hotel would do well to install double glazed windows. As far as value for money - it was a bit on the expensive side but like most major cities in Italy, you pay a large premium for location....If we decided to stay in Florence next time, we would most probably stay there again although we would explore other options.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Hotel 脿 ne pas recommander (chambre 115 /1er 茅tage)   showReview(22536172, 'full');
Reviews.Author: Paulette27
